III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Technical Assistance was not requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was offered pertaining to R.400.4407 (5) (6). The agency has
updated their water system to city water. It would be a good time to replace
shower curtains and shower heads. The female dorm rooms have been repainted,
and it may be time to repaint the common areas as well.
2

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. There was an increase in
unplanned discharges from last year. This increase was due to the hearing officers
releasing the youth before they completed the program, especially within Wayne
County. There were no corrective action plans, but leadership continues to meet
weekly to ensure that rules and policies are in compliance.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported they feel supported by other staff and their supervisors.
Staff feel that trainings are useful and feel like they are helping the youth they
serve. No concerns were reported.
Youth reported they feel that staff care about them. They feel they are receiving
services and were able to verbalize the help they are receiving. Youth did not report
any concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is well maintained inside and outside. The boys' dorm will be repainted
soon, and the water has been updated to city water. The school is decorated and
inviting. There are no safety concerns to note.
3

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
